WorkItem.Description: Using FreezePane and Excel2007 writer produces an xlsx file that works fine in OpenOffice, however in Excel for Mac it gives the error "Excel cannot open this file. The file might have been damaged or modified from its original format.", similarly in Excel on Windows (unsure of Excel version, sorry) it gives a similar error, but is able to repair the spreadsheet.
WorkItem.Summary: FreezePane causing damaged or modified error

Comments.Message:
I've tried generating a series of workbooks with frozen panes using the Excel2007 Writer, then opening them in both Excel2003 (with the compatibility pack) and Excel2010, but haven't seen any error. While the split is written without all the bells and flourishes that Excel uses, there shouldn't be any problems... however, if I extend the writer logic when I can't actually replicate the error, I'll be very dependent on you to test to see if any changes I make actually fix your problem.

Can you please check which version of Excel (Help/About should tell you), and can you let me know which cell you're freezing on?

Problem identified in the default row value for the freezePaneByColumnAndRow() method
Fixed in SVN
